title: Docs: add full convert response reference
description: Document every convert output field with examples and edge cases: flow_code, test_code, original_to_new_mapping, warnings, dataset_conversion, conversion_runbook_md, external_context.

title: Conversion output contract: publish canonical schema docs
description: Document canonical JSON schema for analyze/convert/explain responses including external_context and dataset_conversion fields; add validation examples.

title: Runbook specificity: extract DAG callback and SLA semantics
description: Extend analysis to capture on_success/on_failure callbacks, SLA/miss callbacks, and map them to Prefect notifications/automation guidance in conversion_runbook_md.

title: Generate pytest tests alongside converted flows
description:
Critical feature: Every converted flow must come with tests that verify the conversion works. Tests should:
1. Call each task and verify return types
2. Test the full flow execution
3. Compare behavior against original DAG where possible
4. Be runnable immediately after conversion

This is THE key differentiator - migrations you can trust.

title: Runbook specificity: parse DAG-level scheduling and defaults
description: Extend parser analysis to extract DAG-level settings (schedule/schedule_interval, catchup, max_active_runs, default_args retries/retry_delay, tags, callbacks/alerts) for migration guidance.
close_reason: Completed: Extended parser to extract DAG-level settings (schedule, catchup, max_active_runs, default_args, tags, callbacks)
